00034 /*
00035  * $Log$
00036  * Revision 1.16  2009/02/06 15:37:39  haraldkipp
00037  * Added stack space multiplier and addend. Adjusted stack space.
00038  *
00039  * Revision 1.15  2009/01/17 11:26:37  haraldkipp
00040  * Getting rid of two remaining BSD types in favor of stdint.
00041  * Replaced 'u_int' by 'unsinged int' and 'uptr_t' by 'uintptr_t'.
00042  *
00043  * Revision 1.14  2008/08/28 11:12:15  haraldkipp
00044  * Added interface flags, which will be required to implement Ethernet ioctl
00045  * functions.
00046  *
00047  * Revision 1.13  2008/08/11 06:59:04  haraldkipp
00048  * BSD types replaced by stdint types (feature request #1282721).
00049  *
00050  * Revision 1.12  2008/08/06 12:43:41  haraldkipp
00051  * First EMAC reset failed on power-up. Initialize EMAC clock and MII mode
00052  * earlier.
00053  * Added support for Ethernut 5 (AT91SAM9XE reference design).
00054  *
00055  * Revision 1.11  2007/09/06 20:07:24  olereinhardt
00056  * Changed phy detection and added support for micel phy (SAM7-EX256 Board)
00057  *
00058  * Revision 1.10  2007/08/29 07:43:52  haraldkipp
00059  * Documentation updated and corrected.
00060  *
00061  * Revision 1.9  2007/05/02 11:20:26  haraldkipp
00062  * Pull-up enable/disable simplified.
00063  * Added multicast table entry.
00064  *
00065  * Revision 1.8  2007/04/20 13:06:08  haraldkipp
00066  * Previous change failed on SAM7X-EK. We are now using PHY address 0 by
00067  * default and disable all pull-ups during PHY reset.
00068  *
00069  * Revision 1.7  2007/04/12 09:13:10  haraldkipp
00070  * Bugfix: PHY initialization may fail with pull-ups enabled.
00071  *
00072  * Revision 1.6  2007/02/15 16:00:45  haraldkipp
00073  * Configurable buffer usage and link timeout.
00074  *
00075  * Revision 1.5  2006/10/17 11:06:12  haraldkipp
00076  * Number of loops waiting for links increased to 10000 and NIC resets
00077  * reduced. This will help to link to auto MDIX via direct cable.
00078  *
00079  * Revision 1.4  2006/10/08 16:41:34  haraldkipp
00080  * PHY address and power down bit are now configurable.
00081  *
00082  * Revision 1.3  2006/10/05 17:10:37  haraldkipp
00083  * Link detection was unreliable. This also caused bug #1567785.
00084  * Now NutRegisterDevice will return an error, if there is no
00085  * link available. Applications may then call NutRegisterDevice again.
00086  *
00087  * Revision 1.2  2006/09/29 12:29:16  haraldkipp
00088  * Several fixes to make it running reliably on the AT91SAM9260.
00089  *
00090  * Revision 1.1  2006/08/31 18:58:47  haraldkipp
00091  * More general AT91 MAC driver replaces the SAM7X specific version.
00092  * This had been tested on the SAM9260, but loses Ethernet packets
00093  * for a yet unknown reason.
00094  *
00095  */

00290 #endif

00320 struct _EMACINFO {
00321 #ifdef NUT_PERFMON
00322     uint32_t ni_rx_packets;       
00323     uint32_t ni_tx_packets;       
00324     uint32_t ni_overruns;         
00325     uint32_t ni_rx_frame_errors;  
00326     uint32_t ni_rx_crc_errors;    
00327     uint32_t ni_rx_missed_errors; 
00328 #endif
00329     HANDLE volatile ni_rx_rdy;  
00330     HANDLE volatile ni_tx_rdy;  
00331     HANDLE ni_mutex;            
00332     volatile int ni_tx_queued;  
00333     volatile int ni_tx_quelen;  
00334     volatile int ni_insane;     
00335     int ni_iomode;              
00336 };

00343 /*
00344  * TODO: Buffers and their descriptors should be part of the EMACINFO
00345  * structure. Actually there will be no dual Ethernet chip (sure?),
00346  * but just to keep the code clean.
00347  */
00348 typedef struct _BufDescriptor {
00349     unsigned int addr;
00350     unsigned int stat;
00351 } BufDescriptor;

00353 static volatile BufDescriptor txBufTab[EMAC_TX_BUFFERS];
00354 static volatile uint8_t txBuf[EMAC_TX_BUFFERS * EMAC_TX_BUFSIZ] __attribute__ ((aligned(8)));
00355 static unsigned int txBufIdx;
00356 
00357 static volatile BufDescriptor rxBufTab[EMAC_RX_BUFFERS];
00358 static volatile uint8_t rxBuf[EMAC_RX_BUFFERS * EMAC_RX_BUFSIZ] __attribute__ ((aligned(8)));
00359 static unsigned int rxBufIdx;

00361 #define RXBUF_OWNERSHIP     0x00000001
00362 #define RXBUF_WRAP          0x00000002
00363 #define RXBUF_ADDRMASK      0xFFFFFFFC
00364 
00365 #define RXS_BROADCAST_ADDR  0x80000000  
00366 #define RXS_MULTICAST_HASH  0x40000000  
00367 #define RXS_UNICAST_HASH    0x20000000  
00368 #define RXS_EXTERNAL_ADDR   0x10000000  
00369 #define RXS_SA1_ADDR        0x04000000  
00370 #define RXS_SA2_ADDR        0x02000000  
00371 #define RXS_SA3_ADDR        0x01000000  
00372 #define RXS_SA4_ADDR        0x00800000  
00373 #define RXS_TYPE_ID         0x00400000  
00374 #define RXS_VLAN_TAG        0x00200000  
00375 #define RXS_PRIORITY_TAG    0x00100000  
00376 #define RXS_VLAN_PRIORITY   0x000E0000  
00377 #define RXS_CFI_IND         0x00010000  
00378 #define RXS_EOF             0x00008000  
00379 #define RXS_SOF             0x00004000  
00380 #define RXS_RBF_OFFSET      0x00003000  
00381 #define RXS_LENGTH_FRAME    0x000007FF  
00383 #define TXS_USED            0x80000000  
00384 #define TXS_WRAP            0x40000000  
00385 #define TXS_ERROR           0x20000000  
00386 #define TXS_UNDERRUN        0x10000000  
00387 #define TXS_NO_BUFFER       0x08000000  
00388 #define TXS_NO_CRC          0x00010000  
00389 #define TXS_LAST_BUFF       0x00008000

00397 
00404 static uint16_t phy_inw(uint8_t reg)
00405 {
00406     /* PHY read command. */
00407     outr(EMAC_MAN, EMAC_SOF | EMAC_RW_READ | EMAC_CODE | 
00408         (NIC_PHY_ADDR << EMAC_PHYA_LSB) | (reg << EMAC_REGA_LSB));
00409 
00410     /* Wait until PHY logic completed. */
00411     while ((inr(EMAC_NSR) & EMAC_IDLE) == 0);
00412 
00413     /* Get data from PHY maintenance register. */
00414     return (uint16_t) (inr(EMAC_MAN) >> EMAC_DATA_LSB);
00415 }
00416 
00417 #ifndef PHY_MODE_RMII
00418 
00424 static void phy_outw(uint8_t reg, uint16_t val)
00425 {
00426     /* PHY write command. */
00427     outr(EMAC_MAN, EMAC_SOF | EMAC_RW_WRITE | EMAC_CODE | 
00428         (NIC_PHY_ADDR << EMAC_PHYA_LSB) | (reg << EMAC_REGA_LSB) | val);
00429 
00430     /* Wait until PHY logic completed. */
00431     while ((inr(EMAC_NSR) & EMAC_IDLE) == 0);
00432 }
00433 #endif
00434 
00440 static int EmacReset(uint32_t tmo)
00441 {
00442     uint16_t phyval;
00443 #if defined (MCU_AT91SAM9260) || defined(MCU_AT91SAM7X256)
00444     uint32_t rstcr_tmp;
00445 #endif
00446 
00447     outr(PMC_PCER, _BV(PIOA_ID));
00448     outr(PMC_PCER, _BV(PIOB_ID));
00449     outr(PMC_PCER, _BV(EMAC_ID));
00450 
00451 #if defined (MCU_AT91SAM9260) || defined(MCU_AT91SAM7X256)
00452     /* Disable TESTMODE and set PHY address 0 and by disabling pull-ups. */
00453     outr(EMAC_PIO_PUDR,
00454 #if !defined(PHY_MODE_RMII)
00455         /* Additionally disable RMII, if not configured. */
00456         _BV(PHY_COL_RMII_BIT) | 
00457 #endif
00458         _BV(PHY_RXDV_TESTMODE_BIT) | 
00459         _BV(PHY_RXD0_AD0_BIT) | _BV(PHY_RXD1_AD1_BIT) |
00460         _BV(PHY_RXD2_AD2_BIT) | _BV(PHY_RXD3_AD3_BIT) | _BV(PHY_CRS_AD4_BIT));
00461 
00462 #ifdef PHY_PWRDN_BIT
00463     /* Disable PHY power down. */
00464     outr(EMAC_PIO_PER, _BV(PHY_PWRDN_BIT));
00465     outr(EMAC_PIO_OER, _BV(PHY_PWRDN_BIT));
00466 #ifdef PHY_PWRDN_NEGPOL
00467     outr(EMAC_PIO_SODR, _BV(PHY_PWRDN_BIT));
00468 #else
00469     outr(EMAC_PIO_CODR, _BV(PHY_PWRDN_BIT));
00470 #endif
00471 #endif
00472 
00473     /* Toggle external hardware reset pin. */
00474     rstcr_tmp = inr(RSTC_MR) & 0x00FFFFFF;
00475     outr(RSTC_MR, RSTC_KEY | (2 << RSTC_ERSTL_LSB));
00476  
00477     outr(RSTC_CR, RSTC_KEY | RSTC_EXTRST);
00478     while ((inr(RSTC_SR) & RSTC_NRSTL) == 0);
00479     outr(RSTC_MR, RSTC_KEY | rstcr_tmp); 
00480 
00481     /* Re-enable pull-ups. */
00482     outr(EMAC_PIO_PUER, _BV(PHY_RXDV_TESTMODE_BIT) | 
00483         _BV(PHY_RXD0_AD0_BIT) | _BV(PHY_RXD1_AD1_BIT) |
00484         _BV(PHY_RXD2_AD2_BIT) | _BV(PHY_RXD3_AD3_BIT) | _BV(PHY_CRS_AD4_BIT));
00485 #endif /* MCU_AT91SAM9XE512 */
00486 
00487     /* Configure MII port. */
00488     outr(EMAC_PIO_ASR, PHY_MII_PINS_A);
00489     outr(EMAC_PIO_BSR, PHY_MII_PINS_B);
00490     outr(EMAC_PIO_PDR, PHY_MII_PINS_A | PHY_MII_PINS_B);
00491 
00492     /* Enable receive and transmit clocks and set MII mode. */
00493 #ifdef PHY_MODE_RMII
00494     outr(EMAC_USRIO, EMAC_RMII | EMAC_CLKEN);
00495 #else
00496     outr(EMAC_USRIO, EMAC_CLKEN);
00497 #endif
00498 
00499     /* Enable management port. */
00500     outr(EMAC_NCR, inr(EMAC_NCR) | EMAC_MPE);
00501     outr(EMAC_NCFGR, inr(EMAC_NCFGR) | EMAC_CLK_HCLK_64);
00502 
00503     /* Wait for PHY ready. */
00504     NutDelay(255);
00505 
00506 #ifndef PHY_MODE_RMII
00507     /* Clear MII isolate. */
00508     phy_inw(NIC_PHY_BMCR);
00509     phy_outw(NIC_PHY_BMCR, phy_inw(NIC_PHY_BMCR) & ~NIC_PHY_BMCR_ISOLATE);
00510 #endif
00511 
00512 //    /* For some unknown reason it seems to be required to read the ID registers first. */
00513 //    if (phy_inw(NIC_PHY_ID1) != 0x0181 || (phy_inw(NIC_PHY_ID2) & 0xFFF0) != 0xB8A0) {
00514 //        outr(EMAC_NCR, inr(EMAC_NCR) & ~EMAC_MPE);
00515 //        return -1;
00516 //    }
00517 
00518 // TODO: Make phy id configurable
00519 /* PHY ID */
00520 #define MII_DM9161_ID_H     0x0181
00521 #define MII_DM9161_ID_L     0xb8a0
00522 
00523 #define MII_AM79C875_ID_H   0x0022
00524 #define MII_AM79C875_ID_L   0x5540      
00525 
00526 #define MII_MICREL_ID_H     0x0022
00527 #define MII_MICREL_ID_L     0x1610
00528 
00529 #define MII_LAN8700_ID_H    0x0007
00530 #define MII_LAN8700_ID_L    0xc0c0
00531 
00532      /* For some unknown reason it seems to be required to read the ID 
00533 registers first. */
00534 
00535      // Check for DM PHY (as used on the ATMEL EK)
00536     if (phy_inw(NIC_PHY_ID1) != MII_DM9161_ID_H ||
00537        (phy_inw(NIC_PHY_ID2) & 0xFFF0) != MII_DM9161_ID_L) {
00538      // Check for MICREL PHY (as used on the Olimex SAM7-EX256)         
00539         if (phy_inw(NIC_PHY_ID1) != MII_MICREL_ID_H ||
00540            (phy_inw(NIC_PHY_ID2) & 0xFFF0) != MII_MICREL_ID_L) {
00541             if (phy_inw(NIC_PHY_ID1) != MII_LAN8700_ID_H ||
00542                (phy_inw(NIC_PHY_ID2) & 0xFFF0) != MII_LAN8700_ID_L) {
00543                 outr(EMAC_NCR, inr(EMAC_NCR) & ~EMAC_MPE);
00544                 return -1;
00545             }
00546         }
00547     }
00548 
00549 
00550 // TODO: END
00551 
00552     /* Handle auto negotiation if configured. */
00553     phyval = phy_inw(NIC_PHY_BMCR);
00554     if (phyval & NIC_PHY_BMCR_ANEGENA) {
00555         /* Wait for auto negotiation completed. */
00556         phy_inw(NIC_PHY_BMSR);  /* Discard previously latched status. */
00557         while (--tmo) {
00558             if (phy_inw(NIC_PHY_BMSR) & NIC_PHY_BMSR_ANCOMPL) {
00559                 break;
00560             }
00561         }
00562         /* Return error on link timeout. */
00563         if (tmo == 0) {
00564             outr(EMAC_NCR, inr(EMAC_NCR) & ~EMAC_MPE);
00565             return -1;
00566         }
00567 
00568         /*
00569          * Read link partner abilities and configure EMAC.
00570          */
00571         phyval = phy_inw(NIC_PHY_ANLPAR);
00572         if (phyval & NIC_PHY_ANEG_TX_FDX) {
00573             /* 100Mb full duplex. */
00574             outr(EMAC_NCFGR, inr(EMAC_NCFGR) | EMAC_SPD | EMAC_FD);
00575         }
00576         else if (phyval & NIC_PHY_ANEG_TX_HDX) {
00577             /* 100Mb half duplex. */
00578             outr(EMAC_NCFGR, (inr(EMAC_NCFGR) & ~EMAC_FD) | EMAC_SPD);
00579         }
00580         else if (phyval & NIC_PHY_ANEG_10_FDX) {
00581             /* 10Mb full duplex. */
00582             outr(EMAC_NCFGR, (inr(EMAC_NCFGR) & ~EMAC_SPD) | EMAC_FD);
00583         }
00584         else {
00585             /* 10Mb half duplex. */
00586             outr(EMAC_NCFGR, inr(EMAC_NCFGR) & ~(EMAC_SPD | EMAC_FD));
00587         }
00588     }
00589 
00590     /* Disable management port. */
00591     outr(EMAC_NCR, inr(EMAC_NCR) & ~EMAC_MPE);
00592 
00593     return 0;
00594 }
00595 
00596 /*
00597  * NIC interrupt entry.
00598  */
00599 static void EmacInterrupt(void *arg)
00600 {
00601     unsigned int isr;
00602     EMACINFO *ni = (EMACINFO *) ((NUTDEVICE *) arg)->dev_dcb;
00603 
00604     /* Read interrupt status and disable interrupts. */
00605     isr = inr(EMAC_ISR);
00606 
00607     /* Receiver interrupt. */
00608     //if ((isr & EMAC_RCOMP) != 0 || (isr & EMAC_ROVR) != 0 || (inr(EMAC_RSR) & EMAC_REC) != 0) {
00609     if ((isr & (EMAC_RCOMP | EMAC_ROVR | EMAC_RXUBR)) != 0) {
00610         //outr(EMAC_RSR, EMAC_REC);
00611         outr(EMAC_IDR, EMAC_RCOMP | EMAC_ROVR | EMAC_RXUBR);
00612         NutEventPostFromIrq(&ni->ni_rx_rdy);
00613     }
00614 
00615     /* Transmitter interrupt. */
00616     if ((isr & EMAC_TCOMP) != 0 || (inr(EMAC_TSR) & EMAC_COMP) != 0) {
00617         //outr(EMAC_TSR, EMAC_COMP);
00618         NutEventPostFromIrq(&ni->ni_tx_rdy);
00619     }
00620 }
00621 
00627 static int EmacGetPacket(EMACINFO * ni, NETBUF ** nbp)
00628 {
00629     int rc = -1;
00630     unsigned int fbc = 0;
00631     unsigned int i;
00632     *nbp = NULL;
00633 
00634     /*
00635      * Search the next frame start. Release any fragment.
00636      */
00637     while ((rxBufTab[rxBufIdx].addr & RXBUF_OWNERSHIP) != 0 && (rxBufTab[rxBufIdx].stat & RXS_SOF) == 0) {
00638         rxBufTab[rxBufIdx].addr &= ~(RXBUF_OWNERSHIP);
00639         rxBufIdx++;
00640         if (rxBufIdx >= EMAC_RX_BUFFERS) {
00641             rxBufIdx = 0;
00642         }
00643     }
00644 
00645     /*
00646      * Determine the size of the next frame.
00647      */
00648     i = rxBufIdx;
00649     while (rxBufTab[i].addr & RXBUF_OWNERSHIP) {
00650         if (i != rxBufIdx && (rxBufTab[i].stat & RXS_SOF) != 0) {
00651             do {
00652                 rxBufTab[rxBufIdx].addr &= ~(RXBUF_OWNERSHIP);
00653                 rxBufIdx++;
00654                 if (rxBufIdx >= EMAC_RX_BUFFERS) {
00655                     rxBufIdx = 0;
00656                 }
00657             } while ((rxBufTab[rxBufIdx].addr & RXBUF_OWNERSHIP) != 0 && (rxBufTab[rxBufIdx].stat & RXS_SOF) == 0);
00658             break;
00659         }
00660         if ((fbc = rxBufTab[i].stat & RXS_LENGTH_FRAME) != 0) {
00661             break;
00662         }
00663         i++;
00664         if (i >= EMAC_RX_BUFFERS) {
00665             i = 0;
00666         }
00667     }
00668 
00669     if (fbc) {
00670         /*
00671          * Receiving long packets is unexpected. Let's declare the 
00672          * chip insane. Short packets will be handled by the caller.
00673          */
00674         if (fbc > 1536) {
00675             ni->ni_insane = 1;
00676         } else {
00677             *nbp = NutNetBufAlloc(0, NBAF_DATALINK, (uint16_t)fbc);
00678             if (*nbp != NULL) {
00679                 uint8_t *bp = (uint8_t *) (* nbp)->nb_dl.vp;
00680                 unsigned int len;
00681 
00682                 while (fbc) {
00683                     if (fbc > EMAC_RX_BUFSIZ) {
00684                         len = EMAC_RX_BUFSIZ;
00685                     } else {
00686                         len = fbc;
00687                     }
00688                     memcpy(bp, (void *) (rxBufTab[rxBufIdx].addr & RXBUF_ADDRMASK), len);
00689                     rxBufTab[rxBufIdx].addr &= ~RXBUF_OWNERSHIP;
00690                     rxBufIdx++;
00691                     if (rxBufIdx >= EMAC_RX_BUFFERS) {
00692                         rxBufIdx = 0;
00693                     }
00694                     fbc -= len;
00695                     bp += len;
00696                 }
00697                 rc = 0;
00698             }
00699         }
00700     }
00701     return rc;
00702 }
00703 
00718 static int EmacPutPacket(int bufnum, EMACINFO * ni, NETBUF * nb)
00719 {
00720     int rc = -1;
00721     unsigned int sz;
00722     uint8_t *buf;
00723 
00724     /*
00725      * Calculate the number of bytes to be send. Do not send packets 
00726      * larger than the Ethernet maximum transfer unit. The MTU
00727      * consist of 1500 data bytes plus the 14 byte Ethernet header
00728      * plus 4 bytes CRC. We check the data bytes only.
00729      */
00730     if ((sz = nb->nb_nw.sz + nb->nb_tp.sz + nb->nb_ap.sz) > ETHERMTU) {
00731         return -1;
00732     }
00733     sz += nb->nb_dl.sz;
00734     if (sz & 1) {
00735         sz++;
00736     }
00737 
00738     /* Disable EMAC interrupts. */
00739     NutIrqDisable(&sig_EMAC);
00740 
00741     /* TODO: Check for link. */
00742     if (ni->ni_insane == 0) {
00743         buf = (uint8_t *) txBufTab[bufnum].addr;
00744         memcpy(buf, nb->nb_dl.vp, nb->nb_dl.sz);
00745         buf += nb->nb_dl.sz;
00746         memcpy(buf, nb->nb_nw.vp, nb->nb_nw.sz);
00747         buf += nb->nb_nw.sz;
00748         memcpy(buf, nb->nb_tp.vp, nb->nb_tp.sz);
00749         buf += nb->nb_tp.sz;
00750         memcpy(buf, nb->nb_ap.vp, nb->nb_ap.sz);
00751         sz |= TXS_LAST_BUFF;
00752         if (bufnum) {
00753             sz |= TXS_WRAP;
00754         }
00755         txBufTab[bufnum].stat = sz;
00756         outr(EMAC_NCR, inr(EMAC_NCR) | EMAC_TSTART);
00757         rc = 0;
00758 #ifdef NUT_PERFMON
00759         ni->ni_tx_packets++;
00760 #endif
00761     }
00762 
00763     /* Enable EMAC interrupts. */
00764     NutIrqEnable(&sig_EMAC);
00765 
00766     return rc;
00767 }
00768 
00769 
00777 static int EmacStart(CONST uint8_t * mac)
00778 {
00779     unsigned int i;
00780 
00781     /* Set local MAC address. */
00782     outr(EMAC_SA1L, (mac[3] << 24) | (mac[2] << 16) | (mac[1] << 8) | mac[0]);
00783     outr(EMAC_SA1H, (mac[5] << 8) | mac[4]);
00784 
00785     /* Initialize receive buffer descriptors. */
00786     for (i = 0; i < EMAC_RX_BUFFERS - 1; i++) {
00787         rxBufTab[i].addr = (unsigned int) (&rxBuf[i * EMAC_RX_BUFSIZ]) & RXBUF_ADDRMASK;
00788     }
00789     rxBufTab[i].addr = ((unsigned int) (&rxBuf[i * EMAC_RX_BUFSIZ]) & RXBUF_ADDRMASK) | RXBUF_WRAP;
00790     outr(EMAC_RBQP, (unsigned int) rxBufTab);
00791 
00792     /* Initialize transmit buffer descriptors. */
00793     txBufTab[0].addr = (unsigned int) (&txBuf[0]);
00794     txBufTab[0].stat = TXS_USED;
00795     txBufTab[1].addr = (unsigned int) (&txBuf[EMAC_TX_BUFSIZ]);
00796     txBufTab[1].stat = TXS_USED | TXS_WRAP;
00797     outr(EMAC_TBQP, (unsigned int) txBufTab);
00798 
00799     /* Clear receiver status. */
00800     outr(EMAC_RSR, EMAC_OVR | EMAC_REC | EMAC_BNA);
00801 
00802     /* Copy all frames and discard FCS. */
00803     outr(EMAC_NCFGR, inr(EMAC_NCFGR) | EMAC_CAF | EMAC_DRFCS);
00804 
00805     /* Enable receiver, transmitter and statistics. */
00806     outr(EMAC_NCR, inr(EMAC_NCR) | EMAC_TE | EMAC_RE | EMAC_WESTAT);
00807 
00808     return 0;
00809 }
00810 
00815 THREAD(EmacRxThread, arg)
00816 {
00817     NUTDEVICE *dev;
00818     IFNET *ifn;
00819     EMACINFO *ni;
00820     NETBUF *nb;
00821 
00822     dev = arg;
00823     ifn = (IFNET *) dev->dev_icb;
00824     ni = (EMACINFO *) dev->dev_dcb;
00825 
00826     /*
00827      * This is a temporary hack. Due to a change in initialization,
00828      * we may not have got a MAC address yet. Wait until one has been
00829      * set.
00830      */
00831     for (;;) {
00832         int i;
00833 
00834         for (i = 0; i < sizeof(ifn->if_mac); i++) {
00835             if (ifn->if_mac[i] && ifn->if_mac[i] != 0xFF) {
00836                 break;
00837             }
00838         }
00839         if (i < sizeof(ifn->if_mac)) {
00840             break;
00841         }
00842         NutSleep(63);
00843     }
00844 
00845     /*
00846      * Do not continue unless we managed to start the NIC. We are
00847      * trapped here if the Ethernet link cannot be established.
00848      * This happens, for example, if no Ethernet cable is plugged
00849      * in.
00850      */
00851     while (EmacStart(ifn->if_mac)) {
00852         EmacReset(EMAC_LINK_LOOPS);
00853         NutSleep(1000);
00854     }
00855 
00856     /* Initialize the access mutex. */
00857     NutEventPost(&ni->ni_mutex);
00858 
00859     /* Run at high priority. */
00860     NutThreadSetPriority(9);
00861 
00862     /* Enable receive and transmit interrupts. */
00863     outr(EMAC_IER, EMAC_ROVR | EMAC_TCOMP | EMAC_TUND | EMAC_RXUBR | EMAC_RCOMP);
00864     NutIrqEnable(&sig_EMAC);
00865 
00866     for (;;) {
00867         /*
00868          * Wait for the arrival of new packets or poll the receiver every 
00869          * 200 milliseconds. This short timeout helps a bit to deal with
00870          * the SAM9260 Ethernet problem.
00871          */
00872         NutEventWait(&ni->ni_rx_rdy, 200);
00873 
00874         /*
00875          * Fetch all packets from the NIC's internal buffer and pass 
00876          * them to the registered handler.
00877          */
00878         while (EmacGetPacket(ni, &nb) == 0) {
00879             /* Discard short packets. */
00880             if (nb->nb_dl.sz < 60) {
00881                 NutNetBufFree(nb);
00882             } else {
00883                 (*ifn->if_recv) (dev, nb);
00884             }
00885         }
00886         outr(EMAC_IER, EMAC_ROVR | EMAC_RXUBR | EMAC_RCOMP);
00887 
00888         /* We got a weird chip, try to restart it. */
00889         while (ni->ni_insane) {
00890             EmacReset(EMAC_LINK_LOOPS);
00891             if (EmacStart(ifn->if_mac) == 0) {
00892                 ni->ni_insane = 0;
00893                 ni->ni_tx_queued = 0;
00894                 ni->ni_tx_quelen = 0;
00895                 NutIrqEnable(&sig_EMAC);
00896             } else {
00897                 NutSleep(1000);
00898             }
00899         }
00900     }
00901 }
00902 
00913 int EmacOutput(NUTDEVICE * dev, NETBUF * nb)
00914 {
00915     static uint32_t mx_wait = 5000;
00916     int rc = -1;
00917     EMACINFO *ni = (EMACINFO *) dev->dev_dcb;
00918 
00919     /*
00920      * After initialization we are waiting for a long time to give
00921      * the PHY a chance to establish an Ethernet link.
00922      */
00923     while (rc) {
00924         if (ni->ni_insane) {
00925             break;
00926         }
00927         if (NutEventWait(&ni->ni_mutex, mx_wait)) {
00928             break;
00929         }
00930 
00931         /* Check for packet queue space. */
00932         if ((txBufTab[txBufIdx].stat & TXS_USED) == 0) {
00933             if (NutEventWait(&ni->ni_tx_rdy, 500) && (txBufTab[txBufIdx].stat & TXS_USED) == 0) {
00934                 /* No queue space. Release the lock and give up. */
00935                 txBufTab[txBufIdx].stat |= TXS_USED;
00936                 txBufIdx++;
00937                 txBufIdx &= 1;
00938                 NutEventPost(&ni->ni_mutex);
00939                 break;
00940             }
00941         } else {
00942             if (inr(EMAC_TSR) & EMAC_UND) {
00943                 txBufIdx = 0;
00944                 outr(EMAC_TSR, EMAC_UND);
00945             }
00946             if (inr(EMAC_TSR) & EMAC_COMP) {
00947                 outr(EMAC_TSR, EMAC_COMP);
00948             }
00949 
00950             if ((rc = EmacPutPacket(txBufIdx, ni, nb)) == 0) {
00951                 txBufIdx++;
00952                 txBufIdx &= 1;
00953             }
00954         }
00955         NutEventPost(&ni->ni_mutex);
00956     }
00957 
00958     /*
00959      * Probably no Ethernet link. Significantly reduce the waiting
00960      * time, so following transmission will soon return an error.
00961      */
00962     if (rc) {
00963         mx_wait = 500;
00964     } else {
00965         /* Ethernet works. Set a long waiting time in case we
00966            temporarly lose the link next time. */
00967         mx_wait = 5000;
00968     }
00969     return rc;
00970 }
00971 
00981 int EmacInit(NUTDEVICE * dev)
00982 {
00983     EMACINFO *ni = (EMACINFO *) dev->dev_dcb;
00984 
00985     /* Reset the controller. */
00986     if (EmacReset(EMAC_LINK_LOOPS)) {
00987         if (EmacReset(EMAC_LINK_LOOPS)) {
00988             return -1;
00989         }
00990     }
00991 
00992     /* Clear EMACINFO structure. */
00993     memset(ni, 0, sizeof(EMACINFO));
00994 
00995     /* Register interrupt handler. */
00996     if (NutRegisterIrqHandler(&sig_EMAC, EmacInterrupt, dev)) {
00997         return -1;
00998     }
00999 
01000     /* Start the receiver thread. */
01001     if (NutThreadCreate("emacrx", EmacRxThread, dev, 
01002         (NUT_THREAD_NICRXSTACK * NUT_THREAD_STACK_MULT) + NUT_THREAD_STACK_ADD) == NULL) {
01003         return -1;
01004     }
01005     return 0;
01006 }

01008 static EMACINFO dcb_eth0;
01009 
01015 static IFNET ifn_eth0 = {
01016     IFT_ETHER,                  
01017     0,                          
01018     {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0},         
01019     0,                          
01020     0,                          
01021     0,                          
01022     ETHERMTU,                   
01023     0,                          
01024     0,                          
01025     0,                          
01026     NutEtherInput,              
01027     EmacOutput,                 
01028     NutEtherOutput              
01029 };
01030 
01040 NUTDEVICE devAt91Emac = {
01041     0,                          
01042     {'e', 't', 'h', '0', 0, 0, 0, 0, 0},        
01043     IFTYP_NET,                  
01044     0,                          
01045     0,                          
01046     &ifn_eth0,                  
01047     &dcb_eth0,                  
01048     EmacInit,                   
01049     0,                          
01050     0,                          
01051     0,                          
01052 #ifdef __HARVARD_ARCH__
01053     0,                          
01054 #endif
01055     0,                          
01056     0,                          
01057     0                           
01058 };
